Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; GILDED
Name: Vase
Description: Wheel-made vase fashioned from a common, buff-coloured clay using the Egyptian technique. The body is globular. The narrow neck flares into an open corolla and bears two fine parallel incisions on the rim. This vessel is covered with a golden slip, on to which ''scratches'' were painted in red ochre on the shoulder. This vessel is typical of the Second Cataract region and Upper Nubia at the end of the Middle Kingdom and during the Second Intermediate Period.
